channel.title: Some stuff I made in photoshop
channel.description:
[center] I'm not really great with using most of photoshop's tools, so I just create things with fonts. I only have 1 good looking font atm
I tried going for a transformer look here [img]http://img831.imageshack.us/img831/5488/transformerlike.png[/img]
[img]http://img406.imageshack.us/img406/8311/rainbowgradient.png[/img]
[img]http://desmond.imageshack.us/Himg100/scaled.php?server=100&filename=blackwhitegradient.png&res=landing[/img]
[img]http://desmond.imageshack.us/Himg688/scaled.php?server=688&filename=definity.png&res=landing[/img]
[img]http://desmond.imageshack.us/Himg20/scaled.php?server=20&filename=rainbowgifo.gif&res=landing[/img]
[img]http://desmond.imageshack.us/Himg710/scaled.php?server=710&filename=quantumv.png&res=landing[/img]
[/center]

item.title: Some stuff I made in photoshop
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

These were all done in photoshop using font al destine, and I doubt that dumb ass site could do this.

To prove, I will explain how each were done.

The first was done with the font: al destine, using 1000 bevel and giving it a texture I got from brusheezy.com

The second has 3 layers, the first layer is a color type, the second is the font, and the third is just black. The font has 100 bevel and 7 sharpness with white glow.

The third is like the first but with an inside shadow and no texture.

The fourth has a color overlay of turquoise and has an inside stroke.

The fifth has 17 frames frames going forward and 17 frames going backwards (just reversed the first frames)

The sixth is like the first and second put together but I used a brush called warning.

Read full topic
